newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Micron puts sold after earnings.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS/Micron puts sold after earnings.

text.p: A big buyer of Micron Technology Inc June 40 puts was selling them out Tuesay as the shares lost a bit of ground, traders said.
The June 40 puts traded a total of nearly 11,000 contracts. Traders said about 9,500 was from one customer that had been buying them in recent weeks expecting bad news.
But after the market close Monday, Micron reported fisacal third quarter earnings of $0.44 a share, up from $0.27 a share in the year ago quarter.
The earnings beat Wall Street's estimate of $0.39 per share. In afternoon trade, Micron was down one at 41-12.
"The numbers were a little better-than-expected but the stock's not done much," said Rob Kovell, a lead market maker in Micron options at the Pacific Exchange.
"The big put buyer came in and sold them out this morning," he said, adding the puts were sold at 7/16 and 3/8.
Jon Najarian, president of Mercury Trading in Chicago, said Micron shares have stiff resistance in the 42-1/2 to 45 zone but their trading pattern is improving.
"The stock looks like it's holding a lot better," he said.
The stock touched 45 in early June and has been trading up in that region ever since, but earlier in the year, it declined sharply after hitting that 45 level.
"It's a much more bullish chart pattern now than it was," Najarian said.
He said that was one reason the options volume was centered around the 42-1/2 and 45 strike prices.
After the June 40 puts, the most active Micron option was the June 42-1/2 call, which traded a total of 6,270 contracts. The July 45 calls traded 2,260.
Traders said volatility in Micron options fell sharply.
Najarian said volatilities had backed down to the 60 area from the 70-80 region.
"Once the news is out they're not as nervous and they take the air out of it," he said.
In other trading, a U.S. brokerage firm rolled a large position in the Bay Networks Inc June 20 calls out to the July 20 calls for a customer, traders said.
The June 20 call traded 7,660 contracts by afternoon and the July 20 call traded about 7,560.
"They sold the Junes and bought the Julys for a quarter of a dollar," said Najarian, whose Mercury Trading is a market maker for both Bay Networks and Micron Technology.
Elsewhere, Gateway 2000 Inc options were fairly busy as the stock rallied on its first session after a two-for-one split.
"There's nothing unusual. A lot of call sellers," said a market maker at the CBOE.
Gateway shares were up 2-3/8 at 36 on volume of more than 6.2 million shares in consolidated late session trading.
